title: Payment processing failed for Enterprise subscription
description: Customer ID 45892 is unable to process payment for their Enterprise subscription renewal ($2,499/month). Transaction ID 78945612 shows declined status with error code PY_4011. Customer attempted payment on 3 different cards (ending in 1234, 5678, 9012) over the past 48 hours. Their subscription expires on January 15th, 2024, and they have 847 active user seats that will be affected. Bank confirms cards are valid with sufficient funds ($50K+ available). Customer's billing contact: sarah.johnson@acmecorp.com has tried contacting us 6 times since January 10th.

title: Mobile app crashes during authentication flow
description: iOS app version 3.2.1 consistently crashes at login screen after entering credentials. Issue started January 8th, 2024 at approximately 14:30 UTC following deployment build #4829. Crash occurs on iOS 16.2-17.1, affecting iPhone 12, 13, and 14 models. Error log shows EXC_BAD_ACCESS in AuthenticationManager.swift line 247. 23% of iOS users (approximately 1,847 users) cannot access the app. Android version 3.2.0 works normally. Customer reports: 'Tried clearing cache (iOS Settings > General > iPhone Storage), reinstalling app 3 times, and restarting device. Nothing works.'

title: Request for dark mode UI implementation
description: Feature request from 127 users collected over Q4 2023 for dark mode support across dashboard and mobile applications. Current white theme causes eye strain during extended usage sessions (average 6.5 hours per user per day based on analytics). Survey data from December 2023 shows 68% of 3,247 respondents prefer dark interfaces. Competitor analysis reveals 9 out of 12 major SaaS platforms already offer dark mode. Implementation should include: automatic OS-based switching, manual toggle in user preferences at /settings/appearance, and persistence across browser sessions. Priority increases as we approach Q1 2024 roadmap planning.

title: Password reset system completely non-functional
description: Password reset emails are not being delivered since infrastructure update on January 12th, 2024 at 09:15 UTC. Affected users cannot access accounts, including admin user admin@company.com who manages 45 team accounts. SMTP logs show 0 successful deliveries out of 234 reset attempts in past 72 hours. Email service provider (SendGrid) reports API key sg_live_xyz123 is valid but receiving 401 unauthorized errors. DNS records for mail.ourservice.com show MX records pointing to 198.51.100.42. Customer lockout is severe - ticket volume increased 340% since January 12th. Temporary workaround: manual password resets through database, but requires 2-3 hour response time.

title: CSV export functionality broken for reports over 5000 rows
description: Data export feature fails when generating CSV files larger than 5,000 rows, affecting quarterly business intelligence reports. Error occurs at 47% completion with HTTP 500 status code. Database query timeout set to 30 seconds appears insufficient for large datasets (current largest export attempt: 23,847 records from Q4 2023 data). Memory usage spikes to 2.1GB during export process on server instance c5.xlarge. 15 enterprise customers affected, including Customer IDs: 1001, 1045, 1089, 1156, 1203 who pay $5,999/month each. Alternative manual export through API endpoint /v2/reports/export requires technical knowledge most business users don't have. Issue started January 9th, 2024 after database migration to PostgreSQL 15.1.

title: Two-factor authentication SMS delivery failures
description: 2FA SMS codes failing to deliver across multiple carriers including Verizon, AT&T, and T-Mobile since January 11th, 2024. SMS provider Twilio reports 15.3% delivery failure rate (normally <1%) with error codes 30008 and 21408. Affected phone numbers include international (+44, +33, +49) and domestic US numbers. User security policy requires 2FA for accounts with admin privileges - 89 admin users cannot access systems. Account lockout affects customers managing combined revenue of $1.2M ARR. Backup authentication via authenticator apps (Google Authenticator, Authy) works normally. SMS logs show 1,456 failed deliveries out of 9,523 attempts between January 11-14, 2024. Carrier-specific failure rates: Verizon 22%, AT&T 18%, T-Mobile 12%.

title: Slack integration for ticket notifications and workflow automation
description: Enterprise customers requesting Slack integration for automated notifications when tickets created, updated, or escalated. Integration should support: webhook notifications to designated channels (#support, #critical-alerts), slash commands (/ticket create, /ticket status 12345), and user mentions for assignment notifications. Customer survey from 247 respondents shows Slack usage at 94% of companies with 50+ employees. Reference implementations: Zendesk Slack app (4.8/5 stars), Jira Slack integration (4.6/5 stars). Technical requirements: OAuth 2.0 authentication, support for Slack Enterprise Grid, rate limiting (1000 API calls per minute), and custom channel mapping. Timeline request: Q1 2024 launch to compete with ServiceNow's recent Slack partnership announcement.

title: Database connection timeouts causing widespread service disruption
description: Intermittent 504 Gateway Timeout errors occurring 15-20 times per hour during peak usage (9:00-11:00 AM EST, 2:00-4:00 PM EST). Connection pool exhaustion on PostgreSQL cluster (3 read replicas, 1 write master) hitting max_connections limit of 200. Database server specs: 32 vCPU, 128GB RAM, 2TB SSD storage running on AWS RDS db.r5.8xlarge. Query performance degraded 340% compared to baseline. Slow queries identified: SELECT statements on tickets table taking 8.5 seconds (previously 1.2 seconds), JOIN operations between users and organizations timing out after 25 seconds. Error rate spiked from 0.1% to 4.7% affecting approximately 1,247 concurrent users. Database CPU utilization peaks at 89% during incidents.

title: Billing address update functionality broken in payment settings
description: Users cannot update billing addresses in account settings at /billing/payment-info since payment processor upgrade on January 10th, 2024. JavaScript console shows error: 'Cannot read property address of null' in billing.js line 145. Form validation fails with 500ms delay before showing generic error message. Affects subscription renewals for 67 enterprise accounts worth $847K ARR due between January 15-31, 2024. Payment processor Stripe webhook events show billing_address.update failures with error code card_declined_billing_address_mismatch. Frontend form data: JSON payload missing postalCode field in API call to PUT /api/v2/billing/address. 156 users reported this issue via support tickets in past 96 hours. Critical for PCI compliance and subscription continuity.

title: Search functionality returning irrelevant results with poor ranking
description: Search engine returning incorrect results for customer queries across ticket database of 45,892 entries. Search for ticket ID 'TKT-12345' returns 0 results despite ticket existing in database. Customer name search for 'Johnson' returns 234 results but target customer 'Sarah Johnson' appears on page 8 (position 187). Elasticsearch cluster running version 7.15.2 with 3 nodes, 16GB heap per node. Index mapping configuration may be incorrect - last reindex performed October 15, 2023. Search relevance score algorithm needs tuning: current average relevance 3.2/10 based on user feedback from 89 queries. Alternative search using SQL LIKE queries in PostgreSQL performs 67% better accuracy but 12x slower (average 2.8 seconds vs 0.23 seconds). 67% of support staff report search difficulties impacting resolution time.

title: API rate limiting blocking enterprise integration workflows
description: Current API rate limit of 100 requests/minute insufficient for enterprise customer integrations requiring batch operations. Customer 'TechCorp Solutions' (Account ID: ENT-7891, $25K/month) needs to sync 5,000+ tickets daily from their CRM system. Bulk import job requires 847 API calls taking 8.47 minutes minimum due to rate limiting. Integration timeouts after 5 minutes causing partial data imports. Rate limit headers: X-RateLimit-Limit: 100, X-RateLimit-Remaining: 0, X-RateLimit-Reset: 60. Competitor Zendesk offers 200 requests/minute for similar tier. API endpoint /v2/tickets/bulk accepts maximum 50 tickets per request. Customer's integration runs 4 times daily (6AM, 12PM, 6PM, 12AM EST) but only 2 succeed. Business impact: delayed ticket resolution, incomplete reporting, frustrated enterprise customers threatening contract non-renewal.

title: Email notification system failing to deliver ticket updates
description: Email notifications for ticket status changes not reaching 43% of users since email service migration on January 9th, 2024. Email delivery logs show 2,847 failed deliveries out of 6,623 attempts over 120-hour period. SMTP authentication failing with error 535 'Authentication credentials invalid' for SMTP server mail.service.com port 587. Email queue backlog: 1,456 pending notifications, oldest from January 10th 08:34 UTC. Affected notification types: ticket assignments, status updates, customer replies, and escalation alerts. Gmail recipients: 67% delivery success, Outlook: 34% success, Corporate domains: 23% success. DNS SPF record: 'v=spf1 include:sendgrid.net ~all' may need updating. Customer satisfaction scores dropped 1.8 points since email issues began.

title: File upload size limit blocking customer documentation attachments
description: File upload system rejecting attachments larger than 10MB causing customer frustration with documentation sharing. Current implementation uses multer middleware with 10MB hard limit in server.js line 67. Customer requests: architectural diagrams (average 24MB), video recordings (45-120MB), database dumps (156MB), and system logs (up to 500MB). 234 upload failures recorded in past 14 days with error 'File size exceeds maximum allowed size of 10485760 bytes'. AWS S3 bucket configuration supports up to 5TB per object. Competitors allow: Zendesk (50MB), ServiceNow (25MB), Freshdesk (15MB). Infrastructure cost analysis: increasing to 100MB limit would cost additional $47/month in S3 storage. Technical implementation requires updating: client-side validation, server middleware, and database schema for file_size column.

title: Dashboard performance severely degraded with loading times over 30 seconds
description: Main dashboard at /dashboard experiencing severe performance issues with average load time 34.7 seconds for accounts with 1000+ tickets. Performance monitoring shows: initial HTML response 2.1s, API calls 18.3s, JavaScript execution 8.9s, DOM rendering 5.4s. Database queries identified as bottleneck: 47 separate SQL queries executed per dashboard load, including inefficient N+1 query pattern on tickets-users relationship. Redis cache hit ratio dropped to 23% (target: 85%) after cache expiration policy changed from 1 hour to 15 minutes. Bundle size increased 340% to 2.7MB after adding new chart libraries. Largest customers affected: Account IDs 1001-1015 managing 15,000+ tickets each. User engagement metrics: 45% bounce rate on dashboard (previously 8%), session duration decreased 67%. CDN performance: 89% cache hit ratio, 156ms average response time globally.

title: Invoice PDF generation creating corrupted files for accounting integration
description: Automated invoice generation producing corrupted PDF files preventing accounting system integration since library upgrade on January 8th, 2024. PDF library puppeteer upgraded from v19.4.1 to v21.6.1 causing compatibility issues with HTML-to-PDF conversion. Corruption symptoms: files open as blank pages, 'PDF structure is damaged' error in Adobe Reader, 0-byte file downloads in 34% of cases. Monthly billing run on January 1st generated 1,247 invoices, 423 reported as corrupted. Accounting software QuickBooks Enterprise cannot import damaged PDFs affecting reconciliation for $2.3M in monthly recurring revenue. PDF metadata missing: /Title, /Author, /CreationDate fields empty. File size inconsistency: valid PDFs average 145KB, corrupted files 23KB. Temporary workaround: manual PDF regeneration taking 3-4 hours per billing cycle.
